summary: Guide on how to remake a character without messing up all your stats
descriptionHtml:
(i know there is a couple of typos and minor errors. Nothing that will throw you off though :P)

This guide is based off of \"How to completely change your character\" by Goldigger1990
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/578
Make sure to thank him if you really appreciate this guide.

It was originally made to help re-stat characters after a race/gender change.
Changing other things won\'t effect your stats. 

I made it to make things a little more clear for newbies and the inexperienced.
It was also made to help out people with Skyrim Redone.

- I recommend using this mod: \"RaceMenu\" 
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/29624 to use a much better Race Menu.
- I recommend using this mod: \"Show Race Menu Precache Killer\" 
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/33226/ to eliminate the Race Menu load time.
- SKSE is required for both files
skse.silverlock.org Download latest version there.

[So let\'s begin.]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
STEP 1: Take down all your stats values.

Take down all your stat values and skill levels.
For example: Health 250 Illusion 75
List will contain names of vanilla Skyrim with its \"console recognized\" and Skyrim Redone variants.
Console recognized will be listed first, then vanilla Skyrim and then SKyrim Redone.
No spaces is done on purpose as it is how you will have to type it in the console.

DO NOT USE THE NON-CONSOLE RECOGNIZED VARIANTS, DUH!


Level
Health
Magicka
Stamina
CarryWeight
Illusion
Conjuration
Destruction
Restoration
Alteration
Enchanting
Smithing
HeavyArmor
Block
TwoHanded (Vanilla: Two-Handed) (Skyrim Redone: Heavy Weaponry)
OneHanded (Vanilla: One-Handed) (Skyrim Redone: Light Weaponry) 
Marksman (Vanilla: Archery) (Skyrim Redone: Marksmanship)
LightArmor
Sneak
Lockpicking (Skyrim Redone: Wayfarer)
Pickpocket (Skyrim Redone: Findersmith)
Speechcraft (Vanilla: Speech)
Alchemy
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
STEP 2: Open the console.

If you use Character Creation Overhaul, first make your character as you normally would 
with the book \"A New Beginning\".

OR (If you don\'t)

In the console* type in
showracemenu

*To access the console press \"~\" (no parenthesis).
Should be just above the TAB key.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
STEP 3: Use console command to adjust values.

- In the consolde type in
player.setav <skillORattribute> <value>

- press ENTER to apply to command
The changed stats should be visible once you enter the skill menu.
They wont be visible yet if you are doing these command from the skill menu,
however they will take effect.



player.setav Health 200 (Attribute example)
player.setav Destruction 50 (Skill example)

- To set your level use this command:

player.setlevel <value>
player.setlevel 25 (Level example)

Now for the final part of restting your character heres what ya need to do:
you will have to get rid of that extra perk point which takes 2 steps.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
STEP 4: Reset your perks.

If you have Skyrim Redone use your \"Potion of Respec\" to reset your perks and get them back.*

OR (If you dont)

You will have to type this into the console.
There is a list of perk codes below.

player.removeperk <perkcode>


*If the \"Potion of Respec\" doesn\'t give you back all your perk points, you can download
Perk Point Book
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25607
REQUIRES SKSE


Now choose your perks and you are set!
Thanks Goldigger1990 for the great guide.

Have fun!




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Here is a list of Perk codes to use to remove or add one your perks.
(Only vanilla codes listed. Skyrim Redone has \"Potion of Respec\" to do this for you)

Speech Tree

author: Supertron
